body_html:
@yaroslavvb Thanks for the tip.

Seems thatimport_meta_graph requires instantiating tf.train.Saver, which fails with ValueError: No variables to save - possibly because I am essentially freezing variables via assign ops once trained. Is there no way to divorce the Saver protocol from restoring a graph and corresponding collections ?
body_text:
@yaroslavvb Thanks for the tip.
Seems thatimport_meta_graph requires instantiating tf.train.Saver, which fails with ValueError: No variables to save - possibly because I am essentially freezing variables via assign ops once trained. Is there no way to divorce the Saver protocol from restoring a graph and corresponding collections ?
body:
@yaroslavvb Thanks for the tip.

Seems that`import_meta_graph` requires instantiating `tf.train.Saver`, which fails with `ValueError: No variables to save` - possibly because I am essentially freezing variables via assign ops once trained. Is there no way to divorce the Saver protocol from restoring a graph and corresponding collections ?
